intro: Oxytropis ovczinnikovii, commonly known as the Ovczinnikov's locoweed, is a flowering plant native to central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its spiny stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically yellow or pale green. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Oxytropis ovczinnikovii is known for its ability to fix nitrogen, which helps improve soil fertility in its habitat.
